result.markdown:
--- title: "Epi year time series" author: Raphael Saldanha date: last-modified --- This notebook aims to cluster the Brazilian municipalities by epidemiological yearly dengue cases time-series yearly (starting on September) by its similarities. ## Packages ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) library(lubridate) library(arrow) library(timetk) library(dtwclust) library(kableExtra) library(tictoc) source("../functions.R") ``` ::: ## Load data Load the aggregated data. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} dengue <- open_dataset(sources = data_dir("bundled_data/tdengue.parquet")) %>% select(mun, date, cases = cases_raw) %>% collect() dim(dengue) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 163326 3 ``` ::: ::: ### Prepare data The chunk bellow executes various steps to prepare the data for clustering. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} tdengue <- dengue %>% # Create year variable mutate(year = year(date)) %>% # Create week number mutate(week = epiweek(date)) %>% # Summarise per year and isoweek group_by(mun, year, week) %>% summarise(cases = sum(cases, na.rm = TRUE)) %>% ungroup() %>% # Center year on September group_by(mun) %>% mutate(year = case_when( week < 40 ~ year -1, .default = year )) %>% ungroup() %>% # Scale cases group_by(mun, year) %>% arrange(week) %>% mutate(cases = scale(cases)) %>% ungroup() %>% # Isolate municipality and year mutate(mun = paste0(mun, "_", year)) %>% select(-year, week) %>% # Arrange data arrange(mun, week) %>% # Prepare time series of municipalities by year mutate(mun = paste0("m_", mun)) %>% pivot_wider(names_from = mun, values_from = cases) %>% select(-week) %>% # Use zero value for years withot week 53 mutate(across(everything(), ~replace_na(.x, 0))) %>% # Transpose as matrix t() %>% # Convert object tslist() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` `summarise()` has grouped output by 'mun', 'year'. You can override using the `.groups` argument. ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} length(tdengue) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 3260 ``` ::: ::: ## Clustering Sequence of `k` groups to be used. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} k_seq <- 3:10 ``` ::: ### Soft-DTW method ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} tic() clust <- tsclust( series = tdengue, type = "partitional", k = k_seq, distance = "sdtw", seed = 13 ) toc() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` 57.795 sec elapsed ``` ::: ::: ### Cluster Validity Indices (CVI) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} names(clust) <- paste0("k_", k_seq) res_cvi <- sapply(clust, cvi, type = "internal") %>% t() %>% as_tibble(rownames = "k") %>% arrange(-Sil) res_cvi %>% kbl() %>% kable_styling() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
k Sil SF CH DB DBstar D COP
k_3 0.4031563 0 1374.1020 1.815846 1.815846 -0.0031426 0.2510340
k_5 0.2026992 0 637.1045 2.212220 3.289061 -0.0077829 0.2125939
k_6 0.2012962 0 789.9708 1.934624 3.349793 -0.0076400 0.1996720
k_9 0.1857222 0 590.9137 1.731738 2.512914 -0.0064367 0.1485845
k_7 0.1722017 0 610.8856 2.051800 3.819412 -0.0098792 0.1824945
k_4 0.1460882 0 988.5335 2.730771 4.481755 -0.0057216 0.2445524
k_8 0.0896679 0 533.7876 2.968425 4.672046 -0.0083726 0.1867060
k_10 0.0350377 0 383.4660 3.196832 5.653586 -0.0076139 0.1967363
````` ::: ::: ### Cluster with higher Silhouette statistic ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sel_clust <- clust[[res_cvi[[1,1]]]] ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} plot(sel_clust) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](cluster_mun_year_epi_year_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggsave(filename = "cluster_mun_epiyear.pdf") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Saving 7 x 5 in image ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} plot(sel_clust, type = "centroids", lty = 1) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](cluster_mun_year_epi_year_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggsave(filename = "cluster_mun_epiyear_centr.pdf") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Saving 7 x 5 in image ``` ::: ::: ### Cluster sizes ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} table(sel_clust@cluster) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` 1 2 3 704 1814 742
